p.s: The speech excerpt given from Michel Barnier, the EU commissioner, at the European American Chamber of Commerce and on the 10th of July in 2018 in New York and published on the website ec.europa.eu, is about the Brexit and what consequences it will have with it and to make it a little bit better.

His argumentivargumentative structure, is that he first talks about the problem, which is obviously the Brexit, then he lists a lot of things why this is a problem after that he points out why a close relationship between UK and EU will make things better at the last thing he said things about the EU and how good their system is.
He is very serious because he did not really talk about his feelings, just in the first line, that he regretregrets the deciciondecision of the UK, and he uses a lot of facts.
In line 6 to 7 he uses aan anaphora impact...impact to establish a connection between the sentences and to show how much the Brexit will impact.
He also did this in line 17, 18 and 22 to establish a connection between his arguments for the relationship.

In the speech are also a lot of anumerationsenumerations, where he listlists things that will be consequences of the Brexit, to underline how much and big they are and how bad, for example in the second paragraph.
But he also did this with good things to underline that there is a way to make everything better (ll. 15-26) or to show how good the European Union is and what they achieved (ll. 27-32).
In line 13 to 14 he uses a hyperbole to emphasizesemphasize how bad it will end even for the US with the words worst case scenario.

Michel Barnier uses inclusive pronouns, like we (f.e. l. 15, 21) whewhen he talks about the EU, but that underlineunderlines that they all want to do that and not just him he also connects him with all people in the EU.
WheWhen he speaks about the US or UK he uses the personal pronouns they and you to distract him and the EU from them.
All in all he makes a connection with the audience, when he said we will help you because he includeincludes them in his speech.
In the first paragraph he just useuses the personal pronoun I and my because he tells them his opinion about the Brexit and to distract his opinion with everyone else opinion.
All in all he talks about the Brexit by using arguments against it and takstalks about ways to help each other.
He did this very serious and formular.
His intuition is very clear, he wants a relationship with the UK, and he emphasizes this really good with his Argumentsarguments and Argumentiveargumentative structure.
